intro: Adenanthos obovatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces yellowish-white flowers that attract nectar-feeding insects. Adenanthos obovatus is a perennial shrub that is well adapted to the dry, temperate climate of its native habitat.
